title: Single white female seeking: Big black squarish italic fellow...
content:
Seriously, though.

I am need of suggestions for a face that is: BIG, BLACK, SQUARISH (or has minimal counters), and is ITALIC (oblique).

Any suggestions?

Hildebrant.
author: Hildebrant

comments.content: Check out Sebastian Lester's Soho Ultra Italic Pro.
Do you need a true italic or will obliquing [FF Extra](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010230918/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=ff%20extra) do?
Oblique is fine. It is going to be one word, set in all caps, so it really doesn't matter.
BTW, this is for the signature of a Trademark so, Stephen, Extra is a little too on the wild side. It still needs to be readable.
Also, right now the best contender is Morgan Sans Black.
Ahh, ok, that helps clarify things. I assume you mean [Morgan Big Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010230918/http:/vllg.com/Feliciano/Morgan/mudTyper+Weights)?

Check out Tankard's Shire Types.  
 [http://www.typography.net/type/shires.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010230918/http:/www.typography.net/type/shires.htm "http://www.typography.net/type/shires.htm")

hhp
Yeah, Morgan Big Black Italic. Sorry.
